texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Regarding EBITDA and CapEx, you can see that CapEx in Innovative Materials remains high with significant  investments made on the emerging markets for automotive glass and for flat glass in Columbia, Brazil, India, but  we also invested in energy efficiency in SAGE in the US. EBITDA minus investments, €326 million over the  period.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Regarding exterior solutions, you see a minus 1.2% there. This is essentially due to pipe, as previously announced,  because pipe is at minus 12% over the period. Other activities in exterior solutions, mortar and exterior business  in the US are still in positive territory.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: So I'll hand it over back to Pierre-André, who is going to tell us about the outlook and the action plan moving  Pierre-André de Chalendar  Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA  Well, first, let's take a look at the economic outlook for H2. Although, we know that the economic climate is not  going to be easy to forecast, what we've decided to go with is that in Western Europe, conditions are going to  remain difficult in the automotive market.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: The context may be slightly different, but the worse the economic climate gets and the worse the prices of energy  and raw material may get – of course, they may soften. These prices may soften little bit, although we don't see  that happening yet. And therefore, we need to pass through the increases in the prices of raw material and energy  into our sales prices in a varied manner, depending on the sector.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Now, if we look at the cost savings by business sector, you can see that this concerns every business sector. Of  course, the flat glass activity is going to contribute the most, but all of our business sectors are concerned. Now, if  we take a look at the type of costs we're going to cut, first of all, overheads in which we believe, we should be able  to make a cost saving of about €100 million.  Here we see that the programs that we launched three to four years ago have already given us certain savings and  now make it possible for us to launch new reductions by basing ourselves on the centralization of support  functions that we done earlier. And therefore, we can continue to cut our overheads and general structural costs in  our businesses.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: I've already talked about the main points for the first half. We will continue to restructure in flat glass. We've  already done a lot of work there. But other measures have to come in the second half as well as in pipes.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Now, in these investments, we are going to do, all we can, to preserve our investments in emerging countries, and  concerning energy efficiency, which will actually ensure – which will actually account for 80% of our totaled  annual growth CapEx this year.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Sales prices that are – plans are to be increased in insulation, as well as in our exterior solutions products. The  situation, however, is going to be much more uncertain and much more patchy in Western Europe depending on  how different markets evolves and how construction and renovation markets evolved.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: However, we will have a favorable impact on these sectors of our cost cutting action plan. And as you know, it is a  fluctuation in – and the gap between the price and the cost of raw materials and energy is the most sensitive there  for us and, therefore, it might be more in our favor in the second half of the year.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: So, in this context, given that the economic climate has continued to deteriorate since the beginning of the year,  given the scenario, the objectives that we have fixed for ourselves for the second half of the year is, of course, to  continue to raise our sales prices in a measured manner. We consider that we will continue to have declines in our  sales volumes. So we hope to limit them as much as possible. And the operating income for H2 will, of course, be  impacted by the decline in sales volumes and, therefore, should be slightly reduced compared to H1, 2012. And, of  course, we will continue to keep a very sharp eye on our free cash flow and we hope to have a very high level of free  cash flow and a very strong financial structure just as we have today.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Now, short-term prospects, that clearly are going to be impacted by the international economic climate and by the  economic outlook in our sectors, but that will not affect the very solid fundamentals of the group with a very well- balanced business portfolio and very well-balanced geographically as well.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: And we believe that we would be resilient and as we have been so far, very clearly, the group is very responsive one  with – we manage to take selective measures and we hope that this capacity to react will help us to very quickly  adapt to the economic climate. But I can't really talk about a strong recovery although, of course, that will happen  once the activity starts to improve.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: And, of course, the group will continue to have a strong financial structure. And these advantages, in spite, of the  rather negative economic climate, does give me a lot of hope for the future of the group.  So this is the end of my presentation, and Laurent and I will take your questions, of course. And first we'll take  questions from the room, then the questions by phone, and then the questions by – through the Internet.

file: SGO - Q2 2013 Earnings Call 25July2013 230 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 25-Jul-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: So these results are overall in line with what we were expecting in particular taking account of the first quarter  where we had the impact of the adverse weather condition of course. So overall, the market conditions, trading  conditions as expected were harsh even though they were contrasting conditions from one business area and one  region to another. There was an important calendar impact in the first quarter that was not corrected in the  second quarter, so far all of the half year; we had a calendar impact that represents 1.4%, which will be corrected  as time goes on in the third quarter.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: So we had weather conditions that were really adverse in Europe. In some countries, those conditions, Central  Europe went on right until the end of the first half, because in Germany for example for the Saint-Gobain  business, it was good news in the medium term. But the flooding that took place, disastrous flooding Germany in  June of course had an impact that continued right till the end of the first half. And also there were unfavorable  impacts in the Northern part of the United States, where it always cold there but it lasted longer than usual,  especially as last year there was a – the weather conditions were very mild.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: So outside of the weather conditions, certain business areas, of course, they have considerable impacts, but in  North America, good news that we were expecting we saw clearly that the construction industry for residential  buildings so it turnaround well, it's running at a good level in Asia and the emerging world. As expected, the  dynamics are a bit different from one area to the other there, but we saw a return to growth gradually, very much  returned to growth for flat glass for Saint-Gobain. And in Western Europe, overall, we encountered still difficult  trading conditions with the slowdown in industry and in construction at the same time as we expected even  though we see a fledgling recovery from the end of the first quarter onwards – the first half onwards sorry in the  U.K.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Another important point, and you know this is always first a priority for Saint Gobain, we continue to see an  increase in our selling prices about 1% in the first half against a stable backdrop for raw materials and energy  prices. Also, we kept at close watch on our cash. Our CapEx in the first half down by over €200 million compared  – in euro of course – compared with the previous year. We were very prudent about acquisitions too, which we  limited to just about €40 million in the first half, but that didn't prevent us from doing targeted development in  key growth areas for our group, there are three of them, that's the emerging countries and Asia. Energy efficiency  – energy and the environment, EEE, as we call it, and then consolidation in building – the building distribution  sector and in Construction Products.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: So we started off a coating line so as to upgrade our possibilities in Flat Glass in Brazil then we pursued our efforts  to grow in Mexico and China, which are really buoyant markets of course. And we're starting off right now too –  roughly the CapEx took place at this start of this year. We're starting off a plant, a proppant plant in the U.S., a  ceramic beads that's for the hydrocarbon market. And among the acquisitions we made, there is a small amount  for that, but nonetheless it's an important acquisition will be worthwhile in the long – in the medium-term, it's an  acquisition of plastics in Brazil.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: We are currently gradually restructuring, as I've said regarding the components, the components in the solar – for  the solar industry, we discontinued a line in Poland and we pruned down our business activity level in Germany.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: And if you separate out the first and the second quarters, the impact of the scope effect in the second quarter is  negative to the tune of minus 3. – minus 3.3%. So that's the trend that will be sustained for the full year in terms  of the contribution to the group's sales for the full year. You see a minus 3.2% on like-for-like basis here. So the  price effect is up 1%. That's a good price increase given the fact that there is steadying up of energy and raw  material prices minus 4.2% then for volume. That's quite an improvement compared with the first quarter,  because we said, 6.3% – minus 6.3% in the first quarter.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: So the operating income, as you see on the screen going to €1.26 billion this year. So that's down of course, down  15.7% the group margin, 6.1% that is slightly shrinking compared to 6.9% figure we had last year. Good resilience  though of our non-distribution businesses, the margin grows from 8.9% and 9% in spite of the drop in volumes in  Europe because of the adverse weather condition in the first quarter. In particular, thanks to the improvement of  the gap between price and cost in certain areas, especially in Exterior Solutions.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: The non-operating items here between the operating income and the business income, I'll go back to the provision  for asbestos-related litigation later and that's stable as you see. You see the other expenses going up quite  substantially here between last year and this year that's because of the restructuring plans that we're pursuing  within the group. Almost 50% of that sum devoted to the restructuring within the Flat Glass with a lot of  restructuring in our float glass areas but also in Sekurit, an arbitrage in Spain, but we're doing also in The  Netherlands of course so and in solar panel glass. So we're spending a lot of money at the moment to turn around  the Flat Glass business of course, that's reflected there.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: These are the trends that you can see on this slide that's due to weather conditions and the number of work days  during the first quarter, 1.2% for the quarter. During the second quarter, we had a slight improvement of Flat  Glass that's positive and also Interior Solutions as well and distribution as well in the U.K.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: On the contrary, there is still a negative impact of our volumes all in all in Europe. And also, if you look at Exterior  Solutions, as you can see we have a negative 4.1 for this first half that's for Exterior Solutions, that's due to a  reduced stocks on the side of our clients in the U.S.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Now if you look at all of these business sectors and that's very important our price performance is good. All of our  prices are positive, if we look at each and every single business sector. Well, it's less the case for Flat Glass. We  reached, well, zero versus last year. Yet we're positive in emerging countries and slightly in the red in Europe, that  is negative in Europe. This will not offset the cost of energy and raw materials plus 2% of Packaging, for instance.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: And here is another breakdown, that's the sales breakdown and industrial assets breakdown. As you probably  know, what we do usually to appraise the profitability of each business line and long-term trends on these  businesses what we look at is industrial assets. We have Innovative Materials and Construction Products, that's  one-third of our portfolio more or less and then there is building distribution which totals approximately 22%, it's  less capital intensive.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Now, during the second quarter, we have improved. Europe is still in a negative position, but less than before due  to the weather conditions during the first quarter, and the U.S. are up. There is an interesting growth in prices and  volumes, a two-digit type of growth in the U.S.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Then Building Distribution, internally, we have grown, but it's been difficult, minus 4.6%. This really shows that  this business is very much exposed in Europe. Europe was very negative during the first quarter, minus 9% in  volumes in Europe, that's for Building Distribution in Europe during Q1. And then during Q2, volumes gap is  minus 1.7%, therefore, you see the impact of the weather conditions during Q1, which was a major impact on our  businesses.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Even though the weather conditions – even though that was still difficult, there were floodings, for instance, in  June in Germany, yet our business is down, still down, but they've improved compared with Q1 that is minus 2%  and Scandinavian countries that's a big geography for us. That's stable now at 0.6%. And the trends are quite  favorable in the U.K. Our sales in the U.K. are up 8% against – from last year, when – so that really shows that we  improved considerably during the second quarter.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Finally, we'll have look at Packaging. There is a drop in sales that is 2.9% for this half with an interesting price  increase that is plus 2.1%, slightly below the figure we had during H1. But this is due mainly to the comparison  basis last year that is up 2.1% that's the price increase. This is more than the price of energy and raw materials and  therefore, the spread for us is increasing and that's positive for us, if we look at operating income.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Now, we will speed up and we will talk about our geographic areas. This is a pie chart that shows the different  areas, geographic areas and the trends. As you can see, we have drops in sales in France and in Western Europe,  which show that the Q1 had a big impact and progressively, Scandinavia is improving and Germany as well, even  though we have seen the major impacts of floodings during the second quarter.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: So in China, gradual improvement. The first half was marked by slower progression than what we expected. There  was the price effect that was negative given the raw materials and energy price importance in our business areas,  especially in pipes. So we expect to see the pursuit of, let's say, a softer recovery, a bit slower than what we  expected, but that will continue in China and good momentum in Southwest Asia.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: So in Western Europe, industrial markets should stabilize we think, particularly automotive connected with the  trend in automotive production figures. And there will be ongoing difficulties, of course, in construction, we think  given the fact that the situation varies in certain countries, but we should note that it is more favorable in the U.K.  of course. So we think the upturn in the U.K. and Germany should take hold. Thermal renovation also is an  important thing these days, so energy retrofits should shore up our trading.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: The construction market, as such, isn't a dynamic market, that's the least you can say, but we should be shored up  quite a bit by these energy retrofits, refurbishment and so on going on. So if we take out the weather related items  and weather related impact, independently of that, there is an improvement in the second quarter that we've seen  that should be sustained into the second half of the year, but for the moment, depending on the countries, the  situation, of course, vary and somewhere slightly negative. So for the second half, we think we should continue  ramping up our action plan.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: So we're continuing to keep a tight rate on our cash, keeping a close watch, therefore, on cash management and we  want to keep our capital expenditures, of course, in check. As we said, the net debt should be reduced and we will  be keeping a tight rate too on our working capital requirement. But we were trying to work in a selective manner  and strategic areas with energy efficiency being a focus also Asia and emerging countries and we hope to  consolidate in Construction Products and Building Distribution.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: And energy efficiency should drop the markets there, but there will be a gradual improvement we think in Asia,  particularly in pipes. And we should see an improvement in the price/cost spread compared to 2012 in  Construction Products. Our sales price have continued to go up and as raw materials and energy are leveling out  in price, that spread should, therefore, improve compared with last year.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: So France, we've seen there an attenuation of the drop. We've gained market shares with Point.P, and also, we saw  the impact of energy efficiency measures for Point.P is ramping up its efforts and setting up now dedicated outlets  so as to meet the needs of our clients.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: And we'll continue to see moderate organic growth and solid profitability. Now, the drop we saw in the second  quarter, we think, was a bit higher than the trend we see on the side of our clients. So we should see a slight  improvement in the volume trends going forward. So if we sum it all up, we're expecting operating income to  recover in the second half. As I said in February, we were expecting to bottom out between mid-2012 and mid- 2013 now 20 – we consider for in the light of the figures we now have to hand that we bottomed out in the first  half of 2013, aggravated, of course, by the bad weather condition in the first quarter and we think it's starting to  turn on.

file: SGO - Q2 2014 Earnings Call 31July2014 230 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 31-Jul-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: In North America, both the construction and industrial markets proved buoyant despite a slow start given the very  severe weather, contrary to what we had in Europe. But the overall U.S. economy is going strongly as you saw  yesterday with the data on the second quarter.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Concerning – it's coming also from High-Performance Materials, from 12.9% last year to 13.3% last year with a  good performance, which is also above second half last year. It's despite we have volume stabilization in Ceramics,  but we have a negative mix effect in term of products in Ceramics which is weighting on the profitability. But  despite that, this has been more than compensated by the improvement we had in the other businesses in  Abrasives and Textile Solutions and Plastics due to the volume, but also overall due to the cost reduction in HPM.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Exterior Solutions is up 3.9% in internal growth. The second quarter is at 3.8%. The first quarter, you  remembered, suffered from the weak volumes we had in our Exterior Products in the U.S. The volumes were a  little bit better in Q2 on a weak comparison basis last year, but we are not compensating for the difficult  performance due to the weather conditions in Q1.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: The U.S., to finish with, U.S. you remember that Q1 was clearly affected by the weather conditions. We were  negative at 1.4% growth. The second quarter posted a 6.5% growth helped, boosted by our performance both in  Interior Solutions where we have double-digit performance and in High-Performance Materials.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Second item related to this goal. We wanted to reduce the capital intensity in developed countries. We set up a  goal to decrease that between 2013 and 2018 by five points to seven points. The comparison between June and  December is not relevant, so I compared to June. And between June last year and June this year, we are two  points below. So we are also moving probably faster than what we had in mind towards this goal through tight  rein on investments in those regions and better saturation of our production capacities.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Second strategic goal is which is to increase differentiation, to increase a part our activities which are more value- added and more specific to specific customer needs. This is firstly done through R&D efforts and more innovation.  So just a few examples of the innovation that we have launched on the market; new Flat Glass products which  nearly completely, 95%, eliminate condensation while keeping the same type of insulation. This is very promising.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Some new external wall systems combining insulation, Mortars and Flat Glass panels, and others that you see on  this slide. We have continued to work on sustainable habitat where we see there is very strong potential, and we  are working on – we have finalized work with two British universities which are very interesting to model with real  [ph] terms (43:53) the behavior of solution construction in building different types of construction within a kind  of a real bubble where you can have the climate you want for the time you want. And we are getting some very  interesting lessons from that and speeding up our training programs. These are just a few examples.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Now, in terms of the outlook and action plan for the second half of 2014, which is my last point. How do we see  the economic climate for the second half?

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: We think that we have been gaining and we will continue to gain share, so we expect just not to be strongly  penalized by that. But the market in France will not be good in the new housing starts. In renovation market,  which is more important, there may be progressively good impacts from the measures taken by the government in  terms of energy efficiency, but this is probably more in the latter part of the year.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: So in this overall framework, what are our priorities? First and like usual, I am not going to change that, and I  think it has been the constant characteristic and we have achieved good results. Saint-Gobain will continue to put  priority on increasing sales prices, even though, as Laurent mentioned, the rise in raw material and energy cost is  getting much smaller.

file: SGO - Q2 2015 Earnings Call 30July2015 230 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 31-Jul-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: North-America, we have seen advance in construction market with – if you remember the first quarter, we had –  due to a change in our pricing policy; we had a very low quarter – first quarter in roofing. And I explained that we  should see the reverse in the second quarter, it happened. So we had – so the two quarters for the U.S. are really  very different because of roofing. But underlying U.S. market on construction is growing steadily, and moderate  growth overall in industrial market. There is one specific market, which is related to oil and gas, which is clearly  significantly affected by the reduction in the price of oil. But overall, I would say moderate growth.

texts.speaker: Laurent Guillot
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer
texts.text: The EBITDA minus CapEx is stable, because we continue to increase our capital expenditures with some  investments in insulation in the U.S. and roofing in the U.S., but also a lot of small mortars project in emerging  markets.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Thank you, Laurent. So in terms, first, of economic climate in the rest of the year, we see a progressive  stabilization in France in H2, more or less in line with what we had, you know, at the beginning of the year. We  expect France to stay negative for the whole of the year. But progressively, it should improve compared to where it  has been and the comparison basis also become more favorable. But clearly, France stays difficult.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: We expect continued good growth in the UK and, overall, in the Nordic countries, although, the situation in the  Nordic countries differ from one country to the other. North America should be – should have a good economy in  the second half, despite the impact still on the oil and gas industry from what – and spreading to several  industries from what – from the low price of oil. But overall, the economy should be good in the U.S. and I think  the construction activities is gathering some small momentum, I would say, even in the second half compared to  the first half. So latest statistics have been quite good.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: In this framework, our priority is to continue the execution of our strategy as defined at the end of 2013, so no  change there. In terms of operation, clearly our first priority remain, as it has been over the last few years, to give  priority to increasing sales price in an environment which is from that standpoint not very easy. We have a low  material and cost inflation sometimes in energy depending on the countries, a cost deflation in energy. But we still  maintain a priority on price.

file: SGO - Q2 2016 Earnings Call 29July2016 230 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 29-Jul-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer
texts.text: Price continues to be slightly negative at 0.6% in an environment which continues to be deflationary overall. In the  industry, price is, in fact, flat in Q2 like in Q1. And knowing that, on the other hand, we benefit from a positive  reduction overall in the market price of our raw materials and energy amounting to approximately €70 million  positive effect for us in the first half.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer
texts.text: This effect is not completely offset by the small and midsized acquisitions that we did in all three sectors. In 2016,  we continue this policy of doing small and midsized acquisitions, with €68 million of financial investment. For  example, a wood-based insulation acquisition in the first half in Construction Products or abrasives in Brazil.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer
texts.text: From a pricing perspective, Interior Solutions operated in a more challenging environment due to the competitive  nature of the business, as well as to the fact that it is also one of those businesses which is benefiting the most on  the other side from the reduction in raw materials and energy bill, which is true for us as well as for competitors.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer
texts.text: On the other side of the spectrum, exterior products in the U.S. saw a strong acceleration of volumes in the  second quarter, with roofing benefiting from increased activity triggered in particular by hail storms in several  regions of the U.S. Demand in roofing continues to be strong and we have announced price increases in June  and August to offset the beginning of the rebound of the price of asphalt. Mortars reported organic growth, led by  Asia and emerging countries, and by the improvement in Western Europe, which offsets tougher conditions in  Brazil.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: So a few words now about the outlook and our action plan. In terms of the economic climate, we have seen  stabilizing trends in France. They should progressively improve as we see more and more evidence about the  increase in the new-build activity. We have started to see that in some of our Distribution activities in the products  linked to foundations. The bulk of what Saint-Gobain adds is later in the cycle but we are – so we are going to see  – I think I've been cautious on that – I think we will have a progressive impact of the increasing new-build activity  materializing in the second half.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: And from that standpoint, the July indication in France are positive after a month of June where there was also,  we didn't mention that, that there was a negative impact from very bad weather, the flooding and strikes. So I  think we are more on line with what we have seen at the beginning of the year in July, and we should see a  gradual improvement in France.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: We are going to have a continued good growth in our construction markets in the U.S., where the new activity is  still very positive and the renovation market is good as well. And we continue to see the impact in our roofing but  to a lesser extent, but we will see an impact of the weather incidence in the spring in the delivery of our roofing  products in the second half.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: So I think overall, the economic climate in the second half should continue the trends that we have seen in the  first half. What does that mean for our businesses? Innovative Materials, we expect further profitability gains for  Flat Glass and continued good margins for our High-Performance Materials business.

file: SGO - Q2 2017 Earnings Call 28July2017 230 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 31-Jul-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Good they were in terms of our cost saving programs. We delivered €170 million during the first half. We are also  speeding up our program of small and medium-sized acquisitions. We completed 18 acquisitions in the first half  and we have six being finalized in July, including a bit more important one in Norway where we have acquired our  licensing insulation, that was the only country in Europe where we didn't have our own company in insulation, and  two companies in high performance material also.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: And as you remember, we had said that at the beginning of the year, this was a particularly important challenge  for us as we were facing increasing cost of raw materials and energy. I mentioned in Q1 that we expected our  build to increase by at least €250 million due to price. I now expect a figure more around or above the €300  million mark. Things seems to be stabilizing, however, on the purchasing side. So a great pricing achievement  which was not a given entering the year.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Flat glass delivered solid results in the first half, with 5.6% internal growth including 2.7% of volume, and 2.9% of  price. This good price appreciation, which was steady over the two quarters, allowed us to more than cover the  raw materials and energy evolution.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Moving to Construction Products, where we saw organic growth of 3.7% for the first half, driven by volumes and  particularly pricing at 2.8%. This pricing achievement was important as Construction Products is a business sector  where we see the majority of the raw materials and energy inflation this year. So, this is good news even though  we need to continue to push in this direction.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: In interior solutions, interior solutions grew 4.1% with an increase in both volumes and price against the backdrop  of the strong inflationary environment in raw materials and energy costs. A few example of cost increases that we  have seen would be, for example, steel profiles, paper, but also gypsum, and this deserves particular explanation  because what's happening here is that we are progressively shifting the supply of our plasterboard plants from  using synthetic gypsum, which is a byproduct from coal plants, progressively being shut down in some countries,  to natural gypsum, resulting in some additional costs in those plants which were using desulfurized gypsum. All  the industry is experiencing the same trends, but this adds to the imperative of pushing price overall.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: In pipes, prices increased against the backdrop of rising raw materials and energy costs, but in terms of volumes,  we continue to suffer from the lack of large export contracts. As a reminder, this continues to particularly impact  France and the France sales figures as they are accounted by country of production.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: So, in this framework, our priorities remain constant, as I explained at the beginning of the year. Clearly, we'll  focus on the sales price. You've seen that we have done a good job of increasing prices. As you saw also, it's not  enough in all our divisions because of this increased bill in energy and raw material prices that Guillaume  described.

file: SGO - Q2 2018 Earnings Call 27July2018 230 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 27-Jul-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: In Western Europe, after difficult weather-related first quarter, it's not that the weather was particularly bad, but we  are at two years in a row without any winter. So we had – that impacted the first quarter and even April in a  number of geographies.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: So good figure on the pricing side, and this was an absolute must, as we continue to see our cost of raw  materials, energy and transportation climb in parallel. Our latest expectation for the year is that the amount of cost  increases we'll have to offset is in the €500 million ballpark. Transportation particularly exploded in several  countries, which usually played in our favor in the long run as we have a dense network, but forces us short-term  to pass the surcharges to the market.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: One word on updates, maybe on those one-off issues, to say that most of them are behind us like the Romanian  float glass repair or the Brazilian truck drivers' strike or clearly the Q1 weather. Some of them will last into Q3, but  not Q4 like the Egyptian or the Polish floats, which are going through a longer repair process than the Romanian  float and will both restart in September.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: At the end of April, our Egyptian float plant was hit by the serious floods which impacted the region. We have,  therefore, been unable to produce from the float since then as it is under repair until the end of Q3. You will also  remember that on our Q1 results call, we discussed our need for an accelerated repair schedule in our float glass  plants in Europe due to heavy use resulting in two plants being under repair during the first half. Together with the  Egyptian float, this meant that 3 out of our 30 float plants globally were impacted in the first half in the tight supply  environment.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Western Europe regained a good rhythm in the second quarter after the tough Q1 impacted by the harsh winter  weather. North America continued to trend well both in price and in volume and Asia and emerging markets  continued to grow strongly. The operating margin remained stable at 9.9%, held back by the tough first quarter  given the harsh winter weather and the continuation of the transition towards natural gypsum and away from  synthetic gypsum which is a by-product from coal plant, and which is resulting in some additional costs across the  industry as we talked about last year. This was mitigated, however, by a positive spread for the first half in terms  of price versus raw materials and energy costs for this sector.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: The margin for Exterior Solutions overall contracted to 7% from 8.4%, impacted by the lag between pricing and  raw materials and energy cost inflation in Exterior Products in the U.S. despite the improvement at the end of the  six months.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: Let's now look at the trends by region where we saw organic growth in all four regions over the period. France  grew 3.1% like-for-like in the first half, benefiting from a return to good trends in the second quarter in both the  new construction and renovation markets after the tough start to the year given the harsh weather condition.

texts.speaker: Guillaume Jean Philippe Texier
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: In terms of operating income by region, the operating margin in France widens to 3.3% from 2.5% in the first half  of 2017, boosted by a few exceptional effects and with underlying trends positive in most businesses – in all  businesses. In the rest of Western Europe, however, the margin contracted to 5.4% from 6% in the first half of  2017, impacted by the harsh winter weather conditions at the start of the year. North America saw margins  tightened to 11.1% against 11.8% in the first half of 2017, with the price increase achieved in Exterior Products in  the U.S. lagging the increase in raw materials and energy costs, as I mentioned. And lastly, Asia and emerging  countries saw their margin increase slightly to 10.8% from 10.7% in the first half of 2017.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: And in this context, we expect continued growth and good margin levels in Innovative Materials, with clearly an  improvement in terms of margins in Flat Glass. Construction Products should have a good volume and pricing,  with a catch-up in our U.S. businesses, where we have been lacking, but where the pricing is gathering  momentum in Exterior Solutions. So, we are focusing on this price-cost spread, and Building Distribution should  benefit from what I mentioned in terms of the overall economic climate in Europe.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: So, in these frameworks, our priorities for the second half remain very much consistent with the one we had for  the first half. So, a focus on sales prices, I think that you have seen that there is a good momentum there, but it is  absolutely key for us to continue, because costs, especially in the energy side have not gone, in the last quarter,  in a good direction. So, there has been more pressure on costs, but we are succeeding in our price increase.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: We will continue our cost cutting program, with targeting savings for this year overall compared to the cost base of  last year around €300 million. I think we are on track with that.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Compagnie de Saint-Gobain SA
texts.text: And third category, which his not directly our customer, but which is becoming a very important, a very important  agent for us is the end user of our product. We sell generally all our solutions, Saint-Gobain is a B2B company,  that the end user, whether it is the homeowner, whether it is the occupant of a large office or whether it is a car  driver, even are becoming, the end user is becoming extremely important. And I think our solutions, based on the  combination and comfort and sustainability, are clearly very important. But we need to take that into account more  and more and to use this power of prescription to increase our sales.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future

So this is a crisis that  affected the whole world, in Europe and North America, with a very strong recession in most  western countries. The construction markets were down everywhere and industrial markets  between October, November ‘08 and February or March have declined very, very steeply in the first  half with a slight recovery in the second half.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future
texts.text: And from that point of view, when I look at what we did in ‘09, I think that we were able to tick  practically all the squares. For the operating one, we said that we would try and have positive prices throughout the year,  although the environment was towards deflation. And we decided to give a priority to our sales  price. We had 0.8% over the year, whereas in ‘08 we had a progressive increase of prices, and so  it was more difficult for us to raise them.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future

So generally we really scaled back to a large extent.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future

And very good in H2, due to lower  commodity and energy prices, but the price/cost scissor effect for the year has been positive  overall.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future
texts.text: Reduction in CapEx, ahead of target, 42% drop, and I spoke about that already. Major CapEx  control here, both in H1 and H2, because the reduction from last year was just as significant.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future

texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future
texts.text: Now, looking at our operating margin, it’s slightly up, up from H1 to H2 in spite of low volume. In  Interior Solutions, plus 0.2%. Regarding Exterior Solutions, you can see that since H1 ‘08,  there has been improvement in margin due to the difference between prices and commodity prices  in certain businesses, in spite of certain raw materials that increased in H2, asphalt ore, and there  was also the impact of our cost reduction efforts.       corrected transcript

texts.text: Pierre-André de Chalendar, Chief Executive Officer  A few elements on strategy before I talk about the future prospects of 2010. Because Saint-Gobain’s ambition, it seems to me, to be even more successful today than in  the past. Let me remind you that we have a world leadership position in housing and home improve  – construction and home improvements, and especially because we have very innovative solutions  for growth and the environment as well as energy. So we have very unique position compared to  the other players in this market. So our position has been reinforced.

texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future

texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future

texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future

And  of course, active glazing which is going to be – of course, this is a niche material for the moment,  but it’s going to continue to expand in the future.

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future

texts.speaker: Pierre-André de Chalendar, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Well, good morning, everyone. With the CFO, we will be presenting the results for 2009 and future
